long_desc.thetext:
Hi,
currently it is possible to give views their own window by dragging them outside the main window. It seems that this is done by eventually creating a new StandaloneView. If this was instead a new PageLayout we could use this second window as a fully featured workbench with its own layout in the confines of that second window. In a dual screen configuration this would be just awesome ....
Hope someone of you likes the idea.
bye M;chi
You can do this now by opening a new window and setting it up how you like.

Well,
actually I can't. What I _can_ do infact is opening a new window and placing one or more views into that window. But that's not what I mean. This external window does not provide its own layout so as a consequence I _can't_ place my views freely on that window pane. What I want is to be able to have multiple active (as in "side-by-side") views under the regime of that second window. Or am I missing something here - might well be?
Thanks Tod, anyway

Michael, you're not missing anything...;-). See bug 151510, we've been looking into this but I complicated the issue by introducing the new min/max behavior (which we'd now have to support in the 'Detached' window...
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 151510 ***
